title: Stocks drop 2.8%, led lower by tech, as April’s slump continues. - The New York Times
content:
1. Stocks drop 2.8%, led lower by tech, as April’s slump continues.  The New York Times
  2. Stocks Fall as Dow Drops More Than 800 Points  The Wall Street Journal
  3. Nasdaq closes at worst level in over a year on tech earning fears  Financial Times
  4. U.S. stocks take sharp plunge ahead of major tech earnings  CBS News
  5. Stock Market Sell-Off Continues: Dow Plunges 800 Points Ahead Of Big Tech Earnings  Forbes
  6. View Full Coverage on Google News
description: Big technology companies are set to report earnings starting Tuesday. The S&P 500 has dropped nearly 8 percent this month, its worst monthly showing since March 2020.
